This 45-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of chronic lower back pain. He has a history of occasional back pain due to his job as a construction worker but reports that the pain has become more constant over the past six months. He has tried over-the-counter pain relievers like ibuprofen and acetaminophen, which provide temporary relief. He denies any recent injury or trauma. He has no known allergies. His weight is 210 pounds, and his blood pressure is 128/82. Examination reveals tenderness over the lumbar region with full range of motion but pain, and intact reflexes with no sensory deficits. Assessment is chronic lower back pain. Plan: Prescribe physical therapy twice a week for six weeks, continue ibuprofen as needed, consider imaging (MRI) if no improvement, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 30-year-old Asian female presents with a complaint of frequent headaches, described as throbbing and often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light. She has been experiencing these headaches for about two years, with an increase in frequency over the past three months. She has tried acetaminophen and ibuprofen, which sometimes provide relief. She has no significant medical history or known allergies. Her weight is 140 pounds, and her blood pressure is 118/75. Neurological exam shows cranial nerves II-XII intact, no focal deficits, and no papilledema. Assessment is migraine headaches. Plan: Prescribe sumatriptan for acute relief, recommend lifestyle modifications, refer to neurology, and follow-up in 6 weeks.

This 28-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of fatigue and weight gain, feeling unusually tired despite adequate sleep, and gaining 15 pounds in the last three months without changes in diet or activity. She also mentions feeling cold frequently. She has no significant medical history and is not on any medications. Her weight is 160 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Examination shows no goiter or nodules, dry and cool skin, and slightly delayed reflexes. Assessment is suspected hypothyroidism. Plan: Order TSH and free T4 levels, advise on balanced diet and exercise, follow-up in 2 weeks for lab results, and initiate levothyroxine if confirmed.

This 55-year-old Hispanic male presents with chest discomfort and shortness of breath on exertion, described as pressure-like and radiating to his left arm and jaw. He has a history of hypertension and high cholesterol but has not been compliant with his medications. He smokes a pack of cigarettes daily and has a family history of heart disease. His weight is 200 pounds, and his blood pressure is 145/90. Cardiac exam reveals normal S1 and S2 without murmurs, lungs are clear, and EKG shows ST-segment depression. Assessment is suspected angina pectoris. Plan: Refer to cardiology for evaluation and stress testing, initiate aspirin 81 mg daily and nitroglycerin for acute episodes, advise smoking cessation, and follow-up in 1 week.

This 50-year-old African American female presents with joint pain and stiffness, particularly in her hands and knees, worsening over the past year and worse in the morning. She has tried NSAIDs with some relief. She has a family history of osteoarthritis and no known allergies. Her weight is 180 pounds, and her blood pressure is 135/80. Examination shows swelling and tenderness in the PIP and DIP joints of the hands, decreased range of motion in knees, and no focal deficits. Assessment is osteoarthritis. Plan: Prescribe meloxicam 15 mg daily, refer to physical therapy, discuss weight management, and follow-up in 6 weeks.

This 65-year-old Caucasian male presents with difficulty urinating and increased frequency, especially at night, with a weak stream and feeling of incomplete bladder emptying. He denies pain or hematuria and has no significant medical history. His weight is 170 pounds, and his blood pressure is 120/78. Exam reveals an enlarged, smooth prostate on digital rectal exam. Assessment is benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Plan: Prescribe tamsulosin 0.4 mg daily, advise limiting evening fluid intake, follow-up in 4 weeks, and consider referral to urology if no improvement.

This 25-year-old Asian male presents with persistent acne on his face and back. He has tried various over-the-counter products with minimal improvement and feels self-conscious. He denies any significant medical history or current medications. His weight is 150 pounds, and his blood pressure is 115/70. Skin exam shows multiple inflammatory papules and pustules on the face and upper back without cysts or nodules. Assessment is moderate acne vulgaris. Plan: Prescribe topical clindamycin and benzoyl peroxide gel, consider oral doxycycline if no improvement in 4 weeks, recommend a gentle skin cleansing routine, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 40-year-old Hispanic female presents with a complaint of abdominal pain and bloating, primarily after meals, and occasional diarrhea. She reports these symptoms have been occurring for the past six months. She denies any significant weight loss or changes in appetite. She has no significant medical history and is not on any medications. Her weight is 155 pounds, and her blood pressure is 122/80. Abdomen is non-tender with normal bowel sounds. Assessment is irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). Plan: Recommend dietary modifications including a low FODMAP diet, prescribe dicyclomine 10 mg as needed for abdominal pain, advise increased fiber intake, and follow-up in 4 weeks to reassess symptoms.

This 35-year-old Caucasian male presents with a complaint of persistent cough and shortness of breath, especially at night. He has a history of asthma diagnosed in childhood but has not needed daily medication for years. He has been using an over-the-counter inhaler with limited relief. He denies any fever or chest pain. His weight is 175 pounds, and his blood pressure is 118/75. Lung exam reveals expiratory wheezing bilaterally. Assessment is asthma exacerbation. Plan: Prescribe fluticasone/salmeterol inhaler, provide a spacer, advise using albuterol inhaler for acute relief, and follow-up in 2 weeks to monitor control.

This 60-year-old African American female presents with a complaint of dizziness and lightheadedness, particularly when standing up quickly. She reports these symptoms have been occurring for the past three months. She has a history of hypertension but has not been compliant with her medications. She denies any chest pain or palpitations. Her weight is 165 pounds, and her blood pressure is 135/85 sitting and 110/70 standing. Examination reveals no focal neurological deficits. Assessment is orthostatic hypotension likely due to medication non-compliance. Plan: Reinforce the importance of medication adherence, adjust antihypertensive medication, advise on slow position changes, and follow-up in 2 weeks.

This 38-year-old Hispanic male presents with a complaint of recurrent sinus infections, with symptoms of nasal congestion, facial pain, and yellow nasal discharge for the past month. He reports a history of similar episodes every few months. He has been using over-the-counter decongestants without significant relief. He has no known allergies. His weight is 185 pounds, and his blood pressure is 120/80. Examination reveals tender sinuses, erythematous nasal mucosa, and purulent discharge. Assessment is chronic sinusitis. Plan: Prescribe amoxicillin-clavulanate for 10 days, recommend saline nasal irrigation, advise follow-up in 4 weeks, and consider referral to an ENT specialist if no improvement.

This 29-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of severe menstrual cramps that have been progressively worsening over the past year. She reports heavy menstrual bleeding and pain that interferes with her daily activities. She has tried ibuprofen with limited relief. Her weight is 140 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Pelvic exam reveals no masses or tenderness. Assessment is dysmenorrhea. Plan: Prescribe oral contraceptive pills to regulate and reduce menstrual pain, recommend NSAIDs as needed for pain, advise follow-up in 3 months to reassess symptoms, and consider further gynecological evaluation if symptoms persist.

This 42-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of persistent cough and wheezing for the past two weeks. He has a history of smoking one pack per day for 20 years. He denies fever or chest pain. His weight is 190 pounds, and his blood pressure is 125/80. Lung exam reveals wheezing on auscultation. Assessment is chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) exacerbation. Plan: Prescribe a short course of oral prednisone and a combination inhaler (fluticasone/salmeterol), advise smoking cessation, recommend pulmonary function testing, and follow-up in 2 weeks.

This 55-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of increased thirst and frequent urination. She reports these symptoms have been present for the past few months, along with unintentional weight loss. She has no significant medical history. Her weight is 150 pounds, and her blood pressure is 130/85. Laboratory tests reveal a fasting blood glucose level of 220 mg/dL. Assessment is newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus. Plan: Initiate metformin 500 mg daily, provide education on diet and exercise, schedule a follow-up appointment in 1 month to monitor blood sugar levels, and refer to a diabetes educator.

This 33-year-old Hispanic female presents with a complaint of frequent heartburn and acid regurgitation, particularly after meals and at night. She has been experiencing these symptoms for the past six months and has tried antacids with temporary relief. Her weight is 160 pounds, and her blood pressure is 118/76. Examination reveals mild epigastric tenderness. Assessment is gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD). Plan: Prescribe omeprazole 20 mg daily, recommend dietary modifications including avoiding trigger foods, advise elevating the head of the bed, and follow-up in 4 weeks to assess symptom control.

This 48-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of swollen and painful left knee for the past two weeks. He denies any trauma or injury. He has a history of gout and has had similar episodes in the past. His weight is 220 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/80. Examination reveals a swollen, erythematous, and tender left knee with limited range of motion. Assessment is gout flare. Plan: Prescribe indomethacin 50 mg three times daily for pain and inflammation, advise increasing hydration, review dietary triggers, and follow-up in 1 week to monitor symptoms.

This 24-year-old Asian male presents with a complaint of persistent fatigue, muscle weakness, and darkening of the skin, especially in the creases of his hands. He reports these symptoms have been present for several months. His weight is 145 pounds, and his blood pressure is 90/60. Examination reveals hyperpigmentation and hypotension. Laboratory tests show low cortisol levels. Assessment is Addison's disease. Plan: Initiate hydrocortisone replacement therapy, educate the patient on the importance of medication adherence, advise wearing a medical alert bracelet, and follow-up in 2 weeks to monitor response to treatment.

This 36-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of hair loss, particularly around the temples and crown of her head. She reports this has been occurring gradually over the past six months. She denies any significant medical history or current medications. Her weight is 135 pounds, and her blood pressure is 115/70. Examination reveals diffuse thinning of the hair with no obvious scalp abnormalities. Assessment is female pattern hair loss. Plan: Recommend minoxidil 5% topical solution, discuss possible hormonal evaluations, advise follow-up in 3 months to assess hair growth, and consider referral to a dermatologist if no improvement.

This 50-year-old Hispanic male presents with a complaint of frequent urination, particularly at night, and a weak urinary stream. He reports these symptoms have been gradually worsening over the past year. His weight is 180 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/85. Digital rectal exam reveals an enlarged, smooth prostate. Assessment is benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Plan: Prescribe finasteride 5 mg daily, recommend reducing evening fluid intake, advise on pelvic floor exercises, and follow-up in 3 months to monitor symptom improvement.

This 29-year-old African American female presents with a complaint of painful and heavy periods, along with pelvic pain outside of her menstrual cycle. She reports these symptoms have been present for the past year. Her weight is 145 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Pelvic exam reveals tenderness, particularly in the adnexal regions. Assessment is suspected endometriosis. Plan: Refer to gynecology for further evaluation, consider starting oral contraceptives to manage symptoms, recommend NSAIDs for pain relief, and follow-up after the gynecology consultation.

This 40-year-old Caucasian male presents with a complaint of a non-healing sore on his lower lip, present for the past two months. He reports no significant pain but notes that it occasionally bleeds. He has a history of significant sun exposure. His weight is 175 pounds, and his blood pressure is 120/80. Examination reveals a small ulcerated lesion with raised borders on the lower lip. Assessment is suspected basal cell carcinoma. Plan: Refer to dermatology for biopsy and further management, advise sun protection measures, and follow-up after dermatology evaluation.

This 65-year-old Hispanic female presents with a complaint of chronic knee pain, especially when climbing stairs or walking long distances. She reports the pain has been worsening over the past year. She has a history of osteoarthritis. Her weight is 170 pounds, and her blood pressure is 125/78. Examination reveals crepitus and decreased range of motion in the knees, with mild swelling. Assessment is osteoarthritis of the knees. Plan: Prescribe acetaminophen 500 mg as needed for pain, refer to physical therapy, recommend weight management strategies, and follow-up in 6 weeks to assess pain control.

This 52-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of intermittent chest pain, described as a squeezing sensation, occurring with exertion and relieved by rest. He has a history of hypertension and diabetes. His weight is 200 pounds, and his blood pressure is 140/90. Cardiac exam reveals normal heart sounds, and EKG shows T-wave inversions in the anterior leads. Assessment is suspected stable angina. Plan: Prescribe nitroglycerin for acute episodes, refer to cardiology for stress testing, initiate atorvastatin for cholesterol management, and follow-up in 2 weeks to review cardiology results.

This 23-year-old Asian female presents with a complaint of palpitations and dizziness, particularly during exercise. She reports these symptoms have been occurring for the past month. Her weight is 120 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Examination reveals no obvious abnormalities, and EKG shows occasional premature ventricular contractions (PVCs). Assessment is benign PVCs. Plan: Reassure the patient, recommend avoiding caffeine and stress, advise using a heart monitor to track symptoms, and follow-up in 4 weeks to assess frequency and severity of symptoms.

This 45-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of dry, itchy skin, particularly on her arms and legs. She reports this has been worsening over the past three months, especially during the winter. She has no significant medical history. Her weight is 140 pounds, and her blood pressure is 115/75. Examination reveals dry, flaky skin with some excoriations. Assessment is xerosis (dry skin). Plan: Recommend using a moisturizing cream daily, advise avoiding hot showers, prescribe a mild corticosteroid cream for areas of intense itching, and follow-up in 4 weeks to assess skin condition.

This 60-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of progressive hearing loss in his right ear. He reports difficulty understanding conversations, especially in noisy environments. His weight is 185 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/80. Examination reveals a normal external ear and tympanic membrane, with Weber test lateralizing to the left and Rinne test showing bone conduction greater than air conduction in the right ear. Assessment is suspected sensorineural hearing loss. Plan: Refer to audiology for comprehensive

27. This 50-year-old Caucasian male presents with a persistent, non-productive cough and occasional shortness of breath, particularly at night. He has a history of GERD and hypertension. His weight is 190 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/85. Lung examination is clear, and there are no signs of respiratory distress. The assessment is GERD-related chronic cough. The plan is to increase the dosage of omeprazole to 40 mg daily, recommend elevating the head of the bed, advise avoiding meals close to bedtime, and follow-up in 4 weeks to reassess symptoms.

28. This 32-year-old Hispanic female presents with a complaint of frequent headaches, described as throbbing and accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light. These episodes have been occurring more frequently over the past six months. Her weight is 145 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Neurological examination is unremarkable. The assessment is migraine headaches. The plan is to prescribe sumatriptan 50 mg as needed at the onset of headache, recommend keeping a headache diary to identify potential triggers, advise on lifestyle modifications such as regular sleep and hydration, and follow-up in 2 months to evaluate treatment efficacy.

This 28-year-old Asian male presents with lower back pain, particularly after lifting heavy objects, which has been persistent for the past three weeks. He has no history of trauma. His weight is 160 pounds, and his blood pressure is 118/76. Physical examination reveals tenderness over the lumbar region with limited range of motion but no neurological deficits. The assessment is mechanical lower back pain. The plan is to prescribe ibuprofen 600 mg three times daily, recommend physical therapy focusing on core strengthening exercises, advise proper lifting techniques, and follow-up in 4 weeks to assess improvement.

This 65-year-old African American female presents with worsening shortness of breath and swelling in her ankles over the past month. She has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes. Her weight is 170 pounds, and her blood pressure is 140/90. Examination reveals bilateral pitting edema and crackles at the lung bases. The assessment is congestive heart failure exacerbation. The plan is to initiate furosemide 20 mg daily, adjust her antihypertensive medications, recommend a low-sodium diet, arrange for an echocardiogram, and follow-up in 1 week to monitor response to treatment.

This 45-year-old Hispanic male presents with a complaint of abdominal pain and bloating, particularly after meals, which has been ongoing for the past three months. He denies any weight loss or changes in bowel habits. His weight is 180 pounds, and his blood pressure is 120/80. Abdominal examination reveals mild tenderness in the epigastric region. The assessment is dyspepsia. The plan is to prescribe pantoprazole 40 mg daily, recommend avoiding spicy foods, alcohol, and caffeine, advise eating smaller, more frequent meals, and follow-up in 4 weeks to reassess symptoms.

This 25-year-old Caucasian female presents with fatigue, hair loss, and cold intolerance over the past few months. She has no significant medical history. Her weight is 135 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Examination reveals dry skin and mild hair thinning. Laboratory tests show elevated TSH and low free T4 levels. The assessment is hypothyroidism. The plan is to initiate levothyroxine 50 mcg daily, recheck thyroid function tests in 6 weeks, and follow-up to adjust the dosage based on laboratory results and symptom improvement.

This 30-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of a painful, swollen right great toe for the past two days. He denies any trauma or recent changes in activity. His weight is 200 pounds, and his blood pressure is 128/82. Examination reveals a red, swollen, and tender right great toe with limited range of motion. The assessment is gout. The plan is to prescribe colchicine 0.6 mg twice daily until symptoms improve, advise dietary modifications to reduce purine intake, recommend increasing hydration, and follow-up in 1 week to monitor response to treatment.

This 70-year-old Caucasian female presents with memory loss and difficulty performing daily tasks, which have been progressively worsening over the past year. She has a history of hypertension. Her weight is 150 pounds, and her blood pressure is 135/80. Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) reveals a score indicative of mild cognitive impairment. The assessment is suspected Alzheimer's disease. The plan is to refer to neurology for further evaluation, initiate donepezil 5 mg daily, provide caregiver support resources, and follow-up in 1 month to review the neurologist's recommendations.

This 55-year-old Hispanic male presents with a complaint of numbness and tingling in his feet, which has been gradually worsening over the past six months. He has a history of type 2 diabetes. His weight is 185 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/85. Neurological examination reveals decreased sensation in a stocking-glove distribution. The assessment is diabetic neuropathy. The plan is to optimize glycemic control with an increase in his metformin dosage, initiate gabapentin 300 mg at bedtime for neuropathic pain, recommend regular foot care, and follow-up in 3 months to assess symptom control.

This 40-year-old African American female presents with a complaint of a persistent rash on her face and sun-exposed areas, present for the past two months. She has a history of autoimmune disease in her family. Her weight is 140 pounds, and her blood pressure is 118/76. Examination reveals an erythematous, scaly rash on the cheeks and bridge of the nose. The assessment is suspected systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). The plan is to order ANA and other autoimmune panels, refer to rheumatology for further evaluation, recommend avoiding sun exposure, and follow-up in 2 weeks to review test results.

This 35-year-old Caucasian male presents with difficulty sleeping, described as waking up frequently during the night and feeling tired during the day, ongoing for the past three months. He has no significant medical history. His weight is 175 pounds, and his blood pressure is 120/80. Examination and initial sleep hygiene review are unremarkable. The assessment is insomnia. The plan is to recommend cognitive-behavioral therapy for insomnia (CBT-I), suggest melatonin 3 mg at bedtime, advise maintaining a regular sleep schedule, and follow-up in 4 weeks to assess sleep patterns.

This 28-year-old Hispanic female presents with a complaint of irregular menstrual cycles and acne, which have been present for the past year. She has a history of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Her weight is 155 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Examination reveals mild hirsutism and acne. The assessment is PCOS exacerbation. The plan is to prescribe oral contraceptive pills to regulate menstrual cycles, initiate spironolactone for acne and hirsutism, recommend lifestyle modifications including weight loss and exercise, and follow-up in 3 months to reassess symptoms.

This 60-year-old African American male presents with a complaint of persistent hoarseness and a lump in his neck, noticed over the past two months. He has a history of smoking. His weight is 190 pounds, and his blood pressure is 125/80. Examination reveals a palpable, non-tender mass in the right thyroid region. The assessment is suspected thyroid nodule. The plan is to order a thyroid ultrasound and fine-needle aspiration biopsy, refer to endocrinology for further evaluation, advise smoking cessation, and follow-up after the endocrinology consultation.

This 50-year-old Caucasian female presents with a complaint of frequent urination and a burning sensation during urination, ongoing for the past week. She denies fever or flank pain. Her weight is 145 pounds, and her blood pressure is 118/76. Urinalysis reveals positive nitrites and leukocyte esterase. The assessment is acute cystitis. The plan is to prescribe trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole for 5 days, recommend increasing fluid intake, advise avoiding irritants such as caffeine and alcohol, and follow-up if symptoms do not improve within 48 hours.

Her weight is 140 pounds, and her blood pressure is 130/85. Examination: Physical examination reveals tenderness in the scalp and neck muscles, but no neurological deficits. Assessment: Chronic migraine headaches . Prescribe sumatriptan 50 mg as needed for acute migraine attacks, consider prophylactic medication (propranolol 40 mg daily) if migraines persist, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 30 years Caucasian female presents with a complaint of a wrist ganglion. She has a history of intermittent wrist pain and a noticeable lump on her wrist. She denies any recent trauma. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 150 pounds, and her blood pressure is 120/75. Examination reveals a palpable ganglion cyst on the dorsal aspect of the wrist with mild tenderness but no limitation of movement. Assessment: Wrist ganglion

This 40 years Hispanic male presents with a complaint of a wrist ganglion. He reports occasional discomfort and difficulty in wrist movement. He has no significant past medical history and no known allergies. His weight is 180 pounds, and his blood pressure is 130/85. Examination reveals a firm, mobile cystic mass on the dorsal wrist.
Assessment: Wrist ganglion. Proceed with excision of the dorsal wrist ganglion.

This 60 years Caucasian male presents with a complaint of persistent chest pain. He has a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. The chest pain has been present for the past three months and occurs mainly during physical exertion. He has been taking aspirin and atorvastatin as prescribed. He denies any recent chest trauma. He has no known allergies. His weight is 200 pounds, and his blood pressure is 145/90. Examination reveals normal heart sounds and no signs of respiratory distress. Assessment: Angina pectoris
Prescribe nitroglycerin 0.4 mg sublingually as needed for chest pain, consider referral to a cardiologist for further evaluation, and follow-up in 2 weeks.

This 35 years Hispanic female presents with a complaint of persistent cough and shortness of breath. She has a history of asthma since childhood, managed with albuterol inhaler as needed. Recently, her symptoms have worsened despite regular use of her inhaler. She denies any recent infections or fever. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 160 pounds, and her blood pressure is 120/80. Physical examination reveals wheezing on auscultation and prolonged expiration. Assessment: Asthma exacerbation.
Prescribe a course of oral prednisone 40 mg daily for 5 days, increase frequency of albuterol inhaler use, consider adding a long-acting bronchodilator, and follow-up in 1 week.

This 28 years African American male presents with a complaint of severe abdominal pain and bloating. He has a history of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) diagnosed two years ago. The pain has been more frequent and severe over the past month. He has been using over-the-counter antacids with minimal relief. He denies any recent changes in bowel habits or blood in stool. He has no known allergies. His weight is 180 pounds, and his blood pressure is 125/78. Examination: Abdominal examination reveals tenderness in the lower abdomen without rebound tenderness or guarding. Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome
Prescribe dicyclomine 20 mg four times daily, recommend dietary modifications including increased fiber intake, and follow-up in 2 weeks.

This 42 years Caucasian female presents with a complaint of persistent joint pain and stiffness. She has a history of rheumatoid arthritis diagnosed five years ago. Her symptoms have worsened over the past three months, particularly in the morning. She has been taking methotrexate and ibuprofen as prescribed. She denies any recent injuries. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 150 pounds, and her blood pressure is 135/85.

Physical examination reveals swelling and tenderness in the small joints of the hands and wrists. Assessment: Rheumatoid arthritis flare-up. Increase methotrexate dose to 20 mg weekly, continue ibuprofen as needed, consider adding a biologic agent if no improvement, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 50 years Hispanic male presents with a complaint of frequent urination and excessive thirst. He has a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed three years ago, managed with metformin. Recently, his blood sugar levels have been consistently high despite medication. He denies any recent infections. He has no known allergies. His weight is 220 pounds, and his blood pressure is 140/85. Physical examination is unremarkable. Assessment: Uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus
Add insulin therapy (Lantus) starting at 10 units daily, continue metformin 1000 mg twice daily, monitor blood sugar levels closely, and follow-up in 2 weeks.

This 65 years African American female presents with a complaint of dizziness and palpitations. She has a history of hypertension and atrial fibrillation, managed with warfarin and metoprolol. The symptoms have been occurring more frequently over the past month. She denies any chest pain or shortness of breath. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 170 pounds, and her blood pressure is 150/90. Physical examination reveals irregular heart rhythm but no other abnormalities. Assessment: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response. Adjust warfarin dose based on INR, increase metoprolol dose to 50 mg twice daily, consider referral for cardioversion, and follow-up in 1 week.

This 38 years Caucasian male presents with a complaint of chronic lower back pain. He has a history of lower back pain related to his job as a delivery driver. The pain has been worsening over the past six months. He has tried physical therapy and over-the-counter medications with minimal relief. He denies any recent injury or trauma. He has no known allergies. His weight is 210 pounds, and his blood pressure is 128/82. Examination reveals tenderness over the lumbar region with limited range of motion and intact reflexes. Assessment: Chronic lower back pain. Prescribe a stronger analgesic (tramadol 50 mg as needed), recommend continued physical therapy, consider imaging (MRI) if no improvement, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 70 years Hispanic female presents with a complaint of difficulty walking and hip pain. She has a history of osteoarthritis diagnosed ten years ago, primarily affecting her hips. The pain has become more severe and constant over the past few months. She has been using acetaminophen with limited relief. She denies any recent falls or injuries. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 160 pounds, and her blood pressure is 130/80. Physical examination reveals decreased range of motion in the hips and crepitus. Assessment: Severe osteoarthritis of the hip. Prescribe meloxicam 15 mg daily, consider referral to an orthopedic surgeon for evaluation of possible hip replacement, and follow-up in 4 weeks.

This 25 years Asian female presents with a complaint of persistent acne. She has a history of moderate acne since adolescence, which has worsened over the past year. She has tried various over-the-counter topical treatments with limited success. She denies any other skin conditions. She has no known allergies. Her weight is 120 pounds, and her blood pressure is 110/70. Physical examination reveals inflammatory papules and pustules on the face, chest, and back. Assessment: Moderate to severe acne. Prescribe oral doxycycline 100 mg daily, recommend continued use of topical retinoids, consider referral to a dermatologist if no improvement, and follow-up in 6 weeks.

INFORMED CONSENT: The risks, benefits, and alternatives of the procedure were discussed with the patient. The patient was given the opportunity to ask questions regarding the procedure, its indications, and the associated risks. The risk of the procedure discussed includes infection, bleeding, allergic reaction, dural puncture, headache, nerve injuries, spinal cord injury, and cardiovascular and CNS side effects with possible vascular entry of medications. The patient was informed both verbally and in writing. The patient understood the informed consent and desired to have the procedure performed.

His weight is 210 pounds, and his blood pressure is 128/82. Examination reveals tenderness over the lumbar region with full range of motion but pain, and intact reflexes with no sensory deficits. Assessment is chronic lower back pain. Plan: Prescribe physical therapy twice a week for six weeks, continue ibuprofen as needed, consider imaging (MRI) if no improvement, and follow-up in 4 weeks.
